p: Al-Rawahi et al. [ 49] suggested that ellagic acid, ellagi-tannins and gallic acid are the most responsible for the antioxidant activity of pomegranate peels. Furthermore, Amjad and Shafighi [ 50] mentioned that ellagic acid, as a member of phenolics, is deemed to play a substantial part in antioxidant activity. This acid can react with free radicals due to its ability to chelate with metal cations, a potent oxidant against lipid peroxidation in mitochondrion and microsome.
